page.title: 01South-West Andover area
page.content: The south-west Andover area consists of three picturesque villages;{Abbotts Ann, Anna Valley and {Upper Clatford.}The majority of the land is used for farming. One major road (A343 Andover to Salisbury) passes through the area and it is served by a network of minor roads. Most of the population is employed in Andover or at Middle Wallop Army Air Corps but there are many small businesses in the villages. Older schoolchildren travel to Andover but those under 11 attend the local primary schools in Abbotts Ann and Goodworth Clatford. Farleigh Preparatory School stands in parkland in the centre of the area at Redrice. The oldest site in the area is Bury Hill, an iron age fort, south of Anna Valley.The newest site is an estate of houses in Abbotts Ann.
